TEXT.German: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Salomons Tempel[COLOR_REVERT] ([COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Jüdischer Schrein[COLOR_REVERT]) produziert in allen Städten, die das [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Judentum[COLOR_REVERT] praktizieren, 1 Gold/Runde bis zu einem Maximum von 20 Gold. Außerdem verbreitet er das [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Judentum[COLOR_REVERT] in aller Welt und erhöht die Chancen einer Stadt, einen [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Großen Propheten[COLOR_REVERT] hervorzubringen.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Masjid al-Haram[COLOR_REVERT] ([COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Islamic Shrine[COLOR_REVERT]) produces one gold each turn for every city in the world that practises [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Islam[COLOR_REVERT], with a limit of 20 gold. It also spreads [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Islam[COLOR_REVERT] thoughout the world and increases its city's chances of generating a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Prophet[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Mandirs[COLOR_REVERT] ([COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hindu Temples[COLOR_REVERT]) increase a city's happiness and culture. [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Mandirs[COLOR_REVERT] are required to build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hindu Kshetra[COLOR_REVERT] building.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Zapotecs buried many of their rulers in temple tombs, a practice which was shared with the Mayans and Mixtecs. The power a ruler was said to have after death brought fear into the hearts of the living and increased the power of the ruling class.

TEXT.English: (Wikipedia) Mesoamerican pyramids form a prominent part of ancient Mesoamerican architecture. Although similar in some ways to Egyptian pyramids, these New World structures have flat tops (many with temples on the top) and stairs ascending their faces.
